intro: Rockhausenia orbignyana, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, sandy soils. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. Its reproductive strategy involves wind pollination, which is common among members of the Cyperaceae family. Rockhausenia orbignyana is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and supporting local biodiversity.
